comment: I enjoyed taking the class, but it was 100% not a normal online chemistry class. I had 4 sections exams (open notes!) and a practice exam for each chapter. Homework was not too bad as it was done on Smartworks. My advice for ONLINE CLASSES is to prep for the ACS exam, as it was done on a Saturday at 8 am. ACS is a hard exam, fyi
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Lots of homework

comment: It's not too terrible. There's a lot of homework and practice tests and section tests but the deadlines are long and the tests are open notes, although with lockdown browser and webcam. Don't procrastinate and you'll do ok. Don't bother with the lecture videos and animations, they don't help. You have to teach yourself for the most part.

Don't take online chemistry along with other engineering classes. The material wasn't that difficult, but the amount of work required is unimaginable. My grade was high enough to where I could coast through ACS final, but I paid a dear price to earn it. 20 hrs/week of study. Took my own notes from the book. Homework will prepare you for the exams.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lots of homework--Online Savvy

comment: Don't take this class

Accessible professor and a straightforward online class, but you cannot procrastinate otherwise work will start to pile up. Powerpoints and video lectures are provided but I found more success in writing my notes using the textbook. Open note practice tests and section exams that are done through Lockdown. Final exam is in person.

I took chem 1211 online, and I'm always behind on my lab with another professor because he is too lenient and doesn't provide resources to learn besides the textbook. Maybe if the class was in person it'd be different, but another professor does all the video lectures. Barely any structure to the class, easy A but you will only learn the basics.

Class was alright. He's mostly hands off unless you email because he provides videos, the homeworks are good practice, and there's animations that are really helpful. When you get to the ACS final, just remember to study EVERYTHING the guide says, not just the last units with stoichiometry
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lots of homework--Graded by few things

comment: Just do your homework, you can easily get an A before taking the final, good luck on the ACS final. Reach out to  Prof. Cody if you have any issues and he's happy to help.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria--Lots of homework

comment: 15 week module, each had a practice test which helps you a lot with your test score... most of the questions are repeated on the real test. He use smartworks, and gives lecture explaining the specific subject. He gives extra credit!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lots of homework--Lecture heavy

comment: This class is very hard. There are a lot of lockdown browser tests. He doesn't offer extra credits. You have to take the ACS test at the end of the semester, and it is hard also.

I took this class over the summer, and while the lecture was 3 hours, its still the best way to take it. Do your homework and extra credit work, and always run through the practice exams. If you do this, you'll probably get a good grade in the class. Watch out for the ACS final, you have to buy the study guide (just do the practice exams instead).

Dr. Cody is just a super chill professor. There are two tests, both of which are pretty easy if you just pay attention during the lectures. There's a presentation on a research paper which does take effort but isn't too bad. Also there's an essay on "ethics." Also easy. There's weekly homework as well which is self-explanatory. Take him.

Cody is not the worst but also not the best by any means. The class overall is slightly pointless because it's just searching random things which do help for research purposes I suppose. Class is not very structured. Personally liked orgo2 way better in comparison. Again, this class is not hard just tedious.

His class isn't hard at all and isn't really a tough grader but he lacks so much structure and never remembers anything he's talked about. He is hardly accessible outside of class. However, its an easy grade and you meet once a week. The class seems really useful for research purposes, he's just eh. You should take him

Hes chill. He extended deadlines for a lot of assignments. Some weeks there werent any lecture vids or assignments, and it felt like he forgot he had a class... As long as you do the few assignments to the best of your ability, youre good. Chem lit is just busy work for an easy A. Watch his videos as they help you complete the assign./tests.

Throughout all my college years I've never once gotten a single bad grade until I took him for chem 1212 online this summer. I think this was the absolute hardest class I've taken so far. The only reason I ended up with a B is because of a curve but other than that it was blood sweat and tears throughout this summer. His tests are crazy hard

DO NOT TAKE HIM FOR CHEM ONLINE!! took him for it over the summer, he had no idea what the heck he was doing. Ive read his reviews and it sounds like he is only good in class/lecture. He messes up on examples and he messed up on so many questions on our tests, that we lost points for it. really nice guy but sucks as an online professor.

Professor Cody is the best professor because he is so laid back and understands there's on reason to stress students out. He assigns exactly what is needed to learn how to be proficient with using online databases for research. I was expecting a lot of busy work but that was not the case. Tests should be easy if you go to lecture and simply listen.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria

comment: Super nice guy. Understands that us chem or biochem majors are taking harder classes. Do the assignments and go to class (only once a week) since thats how you learn to use the databases. Honestly this class helps with research stuff which is nice. Tests are dumb easy if you look at the stuff he tells you to.
Difficult professor, so much homework. His tests are so difficult and not like what he teachess. Avoid at all costs.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Beware of pop quizzes--Lecture heavy

comment: Summer class and moved quickly, covering about a chapter a class. You must give 150% to this class as it is heavy math and very difficult material. However, Professor Cody took the complicated topics we learned and made them very understandable. He is a phenomenal lecturer, gives very fair exams, and made Chem 1212 my favorite of the Chem sequence!
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Amazing lectures--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Chem lit is the easiest A EVER for a chem major. Cody knows that, so he never tries to waste time or make the class harder than it needs to be. The stuff you learn is relevant for research, and you learn new, tangible things that will help you become a better chem researcher. Lots of busy work, but sooooooooo easy. Take him!

Dr. Cody is great! I suck at chemistry. I am the lowest common denominator in this class. The first time I took chem 1212 with a different prof, I failed. Now that I have Dr. Cody, I'm consistently scoring 20 points higher on assignments. His explanations of everything are super clear and he will sit with you in office hours and explain everything.

Chemistry is one of those courses where you need to do problems everyday. Dr. Cody is a wonderful professor who will give you guidelines to solve any problem. As long as you practice , practice, and practice the problems in the back of the book this will be an easy A. He is easy to reach and more than happy to help!
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS

comment: If you can get through a whole class without talking to the professor, take this.  The PPs are online and the tests/hw are multiple choice. However, he does not care about you, does not see you as a human being, and will never empathize.  This doesn't make him a bad teacher, but it makes him an atrocious person. Don't take if you have disabilities.
ez A+
Easiest grade possible for Chemistry majors.  In need of a quick GPA booster? Take this man!

I took him for Chem 1211 lecture this summer and I absolutely loved him! He was a great teacher and explained chemistry in such a way that it was easier to understand. I am not at all good at chemistry but his lectures were simple and he was always willing to help you outside of class if you were struggling.

I took Cody for chemical literature. It was the easiest class of my chemistry career. It's a hybrid class so you only meet one day a week (if that). He is extremely laid back and he usually cuts lecture after about 30 minutes. The assignments are all online. The tests are typically a mix of in-class and online and the final is all online. Take him!

Lets just say i have a hard time understanding chem Cody was the best teacher i have ever had he explained everything in great detail & if the class didnt understand then he would go over the subject until everyone got it if we hadnt gone over a chapter before a test then he left if off for the next test if u have the chance take take him hes great

Dr. Cody is really nice, but he lectures so quickly; it's impossible to keep up if you're not science-minded. He's really helpful if you see him after class, but is hard to follow when he explains from his PowerPoints. Slides are posted on Vista. Don't need to purchase the current version of the book. Buy a cheap one just for practice problems.

Best lab prof at KSU! Take him if at all possible. Extremely helpful in the lab and is a fair grader. If you show up and do the labs you will get an A.  He knows students don't want to be there the full lab length, so he does whatever he can to speed up the process. Super nice and laid back.

Best lab teacher you can take. Fun guy. Loves georgia tech football. and will always help you if you ask. EXTREMELY easy to get an "a" in. the only way you wont pass is if you are lost and dont ask for help

Had him for lab. Best Chem lab professor out there! He's so sweet and helpful. He's also very lenient. Come to class and put in the required effort and you should make an A. The final is so freaking hard and usually kills grades but thats not made by him and is the same for all classes. Simply put, TAKE HIM IF YOU CAN!

Had him for lab and he was very helpful! Grades very leniently, if you have any questions he will GLADLY help you. Just show up, do the lab, fill out lab report, and it's EASY to make an A. And he puts sports on the television screens during lab..he's VERY laid back!
He makes sure that you understand everything and will help you and answer any questions. I enjoyed him for lab.

Great Professor! He explains things really well. Often, when things were unclear in lecture, the students could ask for help in explanations and suddenly concepts would make sense. He is always available for questions and willing to help. I would recommend him and take him again.
